intro: Gaura epilobioides, commonly known as whorled gaura, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, erect stems with clusters of showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with leaves arranged in whorls around the stems. Gaura epilobioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
